snippet: A professor at Brooklyn College has helped to turn out some of the city’s most wildly inventive young playwrights by shooing them out of their comfort zones.
abstract: Mac Wellman, professor in Brooklyn College's master of fine arts program in playwriting, describes how his unorthodox teaching style has helped produce some of New York's most inventive playwrights; his efforts are being celebrated at JACK theater space's winter/spring festival Damnable Scribbler, featuring works from recent graduates who studied under him.
lead_paragraph: A professor at Brooklyn College has helped to turn out some of the city’s most wildly inventive young playwrights by shooing them out of their comfort zones.
